alert.note: Alert for Henry; Houston (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued March 31 at 3:56AM CDT until March 31 at 4:45AM CDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 445 AM CDT FOR HENRY AND HOUSTON COUNTIES... At 355 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Richards Crossroads to 6 miles northeast of Graceville, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Abbeville, Cottonwood, Fort Gaines, Headland, Dothan, Taylor, Kinsey, Ashford, Cowarts, Webb, Columbia, Rehobeth, Avon, Newville, Madrid, Gordon, Haleburg, Memphis, Shorterville and Crosby. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 700 AM CDT for southeastern Alabama...the Panhandle of Florida...and southwestern Georgia. To report severe weather contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will send your report to the National Weather Service office in Tallahassee.
